page.title: 13SERVICES IN THE VILLAGE
page.content: The village has{mains electricity}from the M.E.B. There is{street lighting along the A51 and on the new housing developments. Woore Ash{reservoir}is at the highest point in the area. Water is pumped from Bearstone to the reservoir to supply Woore and other places nearby. There is no supply of{gas}to Woore. Some people use calor gas; the school uses Liquid Petroleum Gas, supplied by tanker. Mains{sewerage}was not laid until the 1970's, and the treatment centre is at Dorrington Bog. A{doctor}from Audlem holds a{surgery twice weekly at the Victory Hall. The nearest casualty{hospital}is at Hartshill in Newcastle. The{bank}is in a room at someone's house on Tuesday and Friday mornings. The{library}van comes fortnightly.
